metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: Dataset of hydrometeorological observation network (No.4 runoff observation system of Wujing bridge on the Heihe River, 2013)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（4号点-乌靖桥径流观测数据-2013）
metadata.description:
The No. 4 hydrological section is located at Wujin Heihe River Bridge (100.433° E, 39.065° N, 1431 m) in the midstream of the Heihe River Basin, Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The dataset contains recorded by the No.4 hydrological section from 10 June, 2012 to 10 August, 2012, and from 6 September, 2013 to 31 December, 2013. The width of this section is 58 meters and the cross-sectional area is unstable because of human factors. The water level was measured using an HOBO pressure range and the discharge was measured using cross-section reconnaissance by the StreamPro ADCP. The dataset includes the following parameters: water level (recorded every 30 minutes) and discharge. The missing and incorrect (outside the normal range) data were replaced with -6999.
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), He et al. (2016) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年6月13日至11月24日，2013年9月6日至2013年12月31日的黑河中游径流加密观测中4号点的河流水位和流速观测数据。观测点位于甘肃省张掖市靖安乡上堡村黑河桥，河床为砂砾石，断面不稳定。观测点的经纬度是N39°03'53.23"，E100°25'59.31"，海拔1431米，河道宽度58米。前期水位观测采用HOBO压力式水位计，采集频率30分钟；后期采用采用SR50超声测距仪，采集频率30分钟。数据说明包括以下部分：
水位的观测频率30分钟，单位（cm）；数据涵盖时间段2012年6月14日-2012年8月10日，2013年9月6日-2013年12月31日；流量观测，单位（m3）；按照不同水位监测流量，获取水位流量曲线，依托水位过程观测获得径流量变化过程。缺值数据统一采用字符串-6999表示。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考He et al.(2016)。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。针对绿洲-沙漠系统，仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级观测站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度观测塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括HRB的中下游，位于中国西部的干旱地区，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站点——2个超级站和9个普通站。本文报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological studies?
Example.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，收集多尺度观测数据面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological studies is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Example.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，收集多尺度观测的一个挑战是多尺度观测的可用性较差，这阻碍了在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度处理的进展。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that includes long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠系统中长期能量、水汽和碳通量的数据集的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset that includes long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems consists of observational datasets from 2012 to 2021. This dataset includes half-hourly turbulent flux data acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, as well as hydrometeorological data observed from automatic weather stations, and vegetation and soil parameters.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含绿洲-沙漠系统中长期能量、水汽和碳通量的数据集的例子，包括2012年至2021年的观测数据集。该数据集包括由涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的半小时湍流通量数据，以及由自动气象站观测的水文气象数据，以及植被和土壤参数。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度生态水文数据面临的挑战有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: poor availability of multiscale observations, need to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems, ecological degradation, drying up of rivers, desertification
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的可用性差，需要在绿洲和沙漠系统之间保持平衡，生态退化，河流干涸，荒漠化。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key features of datasets that capture energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集的关键特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term observations, energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, methane fluxes, auxiliary data related to hydrometeorology, vegetation parameters, soil parameters, half-hourly turbulent flux data, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, groundwater table data
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期观测、能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、甲烷通量、与水文气象相关的辅助数据、植被参数、土壤参数、半小时湍流通量数据、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、地下水位数据。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many instruments were used for airborne remote sensing missions to cover the FEA in the oasis-desert system?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 用于覆盖绿洲-沙漠系统的FEA的空中遥感任务中使用了多少种仪器？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations were established in the arid regions of western China since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在中国西部的干旱地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of multiscale observations in the context of eco-hydrological research in oasis-desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文研究中，多尺度观测的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are crucial for understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, particularly in oasis-desert systems. They provide comprehensive data across different scales and disciplines, which is essential for addressing the challenges posed by the poor availability of such observations. This approach is exemplified by the HiWATER experiment, which uses hierarchically nested scales to obtain data on various eco-hydrological processes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测对于理解异质表面上的生态水文过程至关重要，特别是在绿洲-沙漠系统中。它们提供了跨不同尺度和学科的综合数据，这对于应对观测数据稀缺所带来的挑战至关重要。这种方法以HiWATER实验为例，利用分层嵌套的尺度获取有关各种生态水文过程的数据。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is the data quality controlled in the collection of hydrological and meteorological datasets in arid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，水文和气象数据集的收集中如何控制数据质量？
Definition.AnswerEn: Data quality is maintained through a rigorous process that includes sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. This ensures that the observational data, whether from flux observation matrices, automatic meteorological stations, or remote sensing technologies, meets the necessary standards for research use.
Definition.AnswerCn: 数据质量通过严格的过程得以维护，包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成。这确保了来自通量观测矩阵、自动气象站或遥感技术的观测数据符合研究使用的必要标准。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the main components and tools used in the collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis-desert areas?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据的主要组件和工具是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis-desert areas involves the use of eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations. These tools measure various parameters such as turbulent fluxes, soil heat flux, air temperature, and humidity gradients. Additionally, data is supplemented with vegetation and soil parameters to provide a comprehensive understanding of the interactions within these ecosystems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区收集能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据涉及使用涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站。这些工具测量各种参数，如湍流通量、土壤热通量、空气温度和湿度梯度。此外，数据还补充了植被和土壤参数，以提供对这些生态系统内部相互作用的全面理解。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection techniques for water level and flow measurements using HOBO pressure water level sensors compare with those using SR50 ultrasonic distance meters in terms of frequency and reliability?
Comparison.QuestionCn: HOBO压力水位传感器和SR50超声波距离计在水位和流量测量的数据收集技术方面，在频率和可靠性上有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques using HOBO pressure water level sensors and SR50 ultrasonic distance meters both involve a frequency of 30 minutes. The HOBO sensors were used in the earlier phase, while the SR50 sensors were used later, potentially due to differences in reliability or environmental suitability. Both methods aim to capture continuous water level data over time.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 使用HOBO压力水位传感器和SR50超声波距离计的数据收集技术均采用30分钟的频率。HOBO传感器在早期阶段使用，而SR50传感器在后期使用，这可能是由于可靠性或环境适应性的差异。这两种方法旨在持续捕获水位数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the observational datasets from the HiWATER experiment differ from those collected in oasis-desert systems in terms of scale and measurement focus?
Comparison.QuestionCn: HiWATER实验的观测数据集与在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集的数据集在规模和测量重点上有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment datasets focus on multiscale and multidisciplinary data, utilizing a hierarchical observation system including flux towers, remote sensing, and eco-hydrological sensors, specifically targeting the oasis-desert interaction. In contrast, datasets from oasis-desert systems emphasize long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane flux observations, with a focus on the ecological stability and socio-economic development of oases, using a network of weather stations and eddy covariance systems.
Comparison.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验数据集专注于多尺度和多学科数据，利用包括通量塔、遥感和生态水文传感器在内的分层观测系统，特别针对绿洲-沙漠相互作用。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集强调长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量观测，关注绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展，使用气象站和涡度协方差系统网络。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data in arid and semiarid regions, and how can these be addressed through data collection methods?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集多尺度和多学科数据时可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何通过数据收集方法来应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges arise due to the poor availability of multiscale observations and the ecological environment degradation in inland river basins, such as drying rivers and lakes and desertification. These can be addressed through hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation, including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, as well as utilizing hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing technologies.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 由于内陆河流域多尺度观测的稀缺和生态环境的恶化，例如河流和湖泊干涸以及沙漠化，面临着挑战。这些问题可以通过分层嵌套的仪器规模来解决，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，以及利用超高分辨率的航空遥感技术。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can long-term observations in oasis-desert ecosystems contribute to a better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统如何有助于更好地理解能量、水汽和碳交换过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and maintaining ecological stability. These observations, using tools like eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations, provide essential data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, which are indispensable for achieving sustainable development and supporting ecological security in oasis-desert areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于识别绿洲-沙漠相互作用和维持生态稳定至关重要。这些观察使用涡度协方差系统和自动气象站等工具，提供关于能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的基本数据，这些数据对于实现可持续发展和支持绿洲-沙漠地区的生态安全不可或缺。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What implications do the observed data patterns from hydrometeorological stations have for understanding the ecological and economic dynamics of arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从水文气象站观察到的数据模式对理解干旱地区的生态和经济动态有什么影响？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The observed data patterns can illustrate the balance between oasis and desert systems and their role in economic and ecological dynamics. They can help in understanding the core ecological landscapes and their impact on agricultural productivity and carbon balance, which are critical for sustainable development in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观察到的数据模式可以展示绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡及其在经济和生态动态中的作用。它们有助于理解核心生态景观及其对农业生产力和碳平衡的影响，这对这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in obtaining multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies, particularly in heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，特别是在异质表面上，获取多尺度观测的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The challenge is due to the complexity of capturing data across various scales and disciplines, as highlighted by the need for hierarchically nested instrumentation and a sparse network in experiments like HiWATER.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程的上升进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。这个挑战源于在不同尺度和学科中捕捉数据的复杂性，正如HiWATER等实验中所强调的，需要分层嵌套的仪器和稀疏的网络。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development in semi-arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在半干旱地区保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对可持续发展至关重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial to achieving sustainable oasis development. Understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange characteristics is vital for ecological security and socioeconomic development, especially as these areas significantly impact the global carbon cycle.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。了解能量、水汽和碳交换特征对生态安全和社会经济发展至关重要，尤其是这些地区对全球碳循环有显著影响。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes difficulties in data collection for hydrometeorological observations in arid and semiarid inland river basins?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域，水文气象观测的数据收集困难的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological challenges like river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, and land desertification. These environmental issues complicate long-term data collection efforts necessary for understanding hydrometeorological processes in these regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化和土地沙漠化。这些环境问题使得在这些地区进行长期数据收集的工作变得复杂，而这些数据对于理解水文气象过程是必要的。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using a sparse network of meteorological stations on the accuracy of multiscale eco-hydrological process observations?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用稀疏的气象站网络对多尺度生态水文过程观测的准确性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a sparse network of meteorological stations may lead to challenges in capturing detailed interactions and variations in multiscale eco-hydrological processes, as these processes are influenced by heterogeneity in surface conditions. This approach might result in less comprehensive datasets, impacting the ability to accurately model and understand eco-hydrological processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用稀疏的气象站网络可能会导致在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程中的详细相互作用和变化方面面临挑战，因为这些过程受到地表条件异质性的影响。这种方法可能导致数据集不够全面，从而影响准确建模和理解生态水文过程的能力。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of representing missing data with a specific string value for data processing and analysis in hydrometeorological datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在水文气象数据集中，用特定字符串值表示缺失数据对数据处理和分析的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Representing missing data with a specific string value, such as '-6999', can facilitate data processing and analysis by providing a consistent method for identifying and handling gaps in the dataset. However, it also requires careful consideration during data analysis to ensure that these placeholders do not inadvertently affect statistical calculations or model outputs.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 用特定字符串值（如'-6999'）表示缺失数据可以通过提供一种一致的方法来识别和处理数据集中的空缺，从而促进数据处理和分析。然而，这在数据分析过程中也需要谨慎考虑，以确保这些占位符不会无意中影响统计计算或模型输出。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to establish a multiscale observation system to study eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立多尺度观测系统以研究绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is a grand challenge due to the poor availability of multiscale observations. A multiscale observation system, like the one used in HiWATER, helps capture eco-hydrological processes at various scales and provides comprehensive data through a combination of eddy covariance towers, remote sensing, and ground measurements.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的尺度是一个重大挑战，因为多尺度观测的可用性较差。像HiWATER所使用的多尺度观测系统，有助于在不同尺度上捕捉生态水文过程，并通过涡度协方差塔、遥感和地面测量的结合提供全面的数据。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended benefits of collecting long-term observational datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测数据集的预期好处是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are crucial for understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding supports the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality and is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, protecting ecological stability, and supporting socioeconomic development in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征至关重要。这种理解支持碳达峰和碳中和的目标，并对识别绿洲-沙漠相互作用、保护生态稳定性以及支持这些地区的社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What challenges do inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face that necessitate the collection of comprehensive hydrometeorological data?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临哪些挑战，导致需要收集全面的水文气象数据？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation challenges like drying rivers, degrading vegetation, desertification, and frequent dust storms. Collecting comprehensive hydrometeorological data helps in addressing these issues by providing insights necessary for managing and mitigating the impacts of such environmental crises.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，如河流干涸、植被退化、沙漠化和频繁的沙尘暴。收集全面的水文气象数据有助于应对这些问题，提供必要的见解，以管理和减轻此类环境危机的影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale eco-hydrological processes captured using instrumentation in arid and semi-arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何通过仪器在干旱和半干旱地区捕捉多尺度生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multiscale eco-hydrological processes in arid and semi-arid regions are captured using instrumentation arranged in hierarchically nested scales, which includes a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and an eco-hydrological sensor network. Intensive observations are conducted using hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing tools such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer, alongside synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，多尺度生态水文过程通过分层嵌套的仪器布置进行捕捉，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和生态水文传感器网络的通量观测矩阵。使用超高分辨率的航空遥感工具，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，进行密集观测，同时进行同步的地面测量，以监测植被动态和光合作用过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed to ensure quality control during the data collection and processing phases in eco-hydrological studies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究的数据收集和处理阶段，采用了哪些方法来确保质量控制？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The methodologies employed to ensure quality control during data collection and processing in eco-hydrological studies include careful calibration of sensors, systematic data collection, processing, and datasets generation. These procedures ensure that observational data are consistently accurate and reliable, and the data are subjected to quality control checks throughout these phases.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在生态水文学研究中，为确保数据收集和处理的质量控制，采用了仔细校准传感器、系统化数据收集、处理和数据集生成等方法。这些程序确保观测数据始终准确可靠，并且在这些阶段中数据会经过质量控制检查。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to establish observational datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中建立能量、水蒸气和碳通量的观测数据集所遵循的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Procedures to establish observational datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems involve long-term data collection using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for turbulent flux data, automated weather stations for hydrometeorological data, and additional observations of vegetation and soil parameters. The data processing includes steps for collection, processing, archiving, and sharing, ensuring comprehensive datasets that include necessary auxiliary data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中建立能量、水汽和碳通量的观测数据集的程序涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行湍流通量数据的长期数据收集，自动气象站用于水文气象数据的收集，以及对植被和土壤参数的额外观测。数据处理包括收集、处理、归档和共享的步骤，确保综合数据集包含必要的辅助数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data processing and quality control methods enable the reliable use of datasets collected from artificial and natural oasis-desert systems over long-term periods?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据处理和质量控制方法能够确保从人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统长期收集的数据集的可靠使用？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The reliable use of datasets collected from artificial and natural oasis-desert systems over long-term periods is enabled by a data processing and quality control procedure that includes data collection, data processing, data archiving, and sharing, ensuring all observational data are carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration and dataset generation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过数据收集、数据处理、数据归档和共享的程序，可靠地使用来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的长期收集数据得以实现，确保所有观测数据在传感器校准和数据集生成过程中都经过仔细的质量控制。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might researchers expect challenges in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么研究人员可能会在收集异质景观中生态水文过程的多尺度观测时遇到挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, as noted in the content of relevant papers. The complexity of capturing eco-hydrological processes across various scales and interactions in heterogeneous landscapes adds to the challenges.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍，相关论文中对此进行了说明。在异质景观中捕捉生态水文过程的复杂性以及不同尺度和相互作用的挑战进一步加剧了这一问题。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What expectations exist regarding the role of oases in arid and semi-arid regions with respect to the global carbon cycle?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 关于绿洲在干旱和半干旱地区对全球碳循环的作用，存在哪些期望？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Oases, which comprise less than 10% of arid regions but support over 90% of the population, are considered carbon sinks and can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions. This role is increasingly important within the global carbon cycle.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 绿洲占干旱地区不到10%的面积，但支持超过90%的人口，被视为碳汇，并能显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡。这一角色在全球碳循环中变得越来越重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might long-term observations be crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange is crucial for recognizing oasis-desert interactions, protecting ecological stability, and supporting socioeconomic development. Long-term observations are indispensable to achieve these goals and maintain ecological balance.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲与沙漠的相互作用、保护生态稳定性以及支持社会经济发展至关重要。长期观测对于实现这些目标和维持生态平衡是不可或缺的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using a sparse network to investigate oasis-desert interactions in eco-hydrological studies?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评价在生态水文研究中使用稀疏网络来调查绿洲-沙漠相互作用的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of a sparse network in eco-hydrological studies is a strategic approach to investigate oasis-desert interactions. This method allows researchers to capture data across diverse landscapes and scales, providing a comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes. The hierarchical nesting of instruments in this approach could offer valuable insights, though it may also face challenges such as data gaps or variability in data quality due to the sparse arrangement.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中使用稀疏网络是一种战略性的方法，用于研究绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用。这种方法使研究人员能够在不同的景观和尺度上捕获数据，从而提供对生态水文过程的全面理解。这种方法中仪器的层级嵌套可能提供有价值的见解，但也可能面临挑战，例如由于稀疏布置导致的数据缺口或数据质量的变异。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection techniques are adapted for capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in this field.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集技术是如何适应捕捉该领域中的多尺度生态水文过程的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The field addresses the challenge of multiscale eco-hydrological processes by using a hierarchically nested scale instrumentation approach. Several intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations were conducted using instruments arranged to capture these processes on different scales. This includes a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and airborne remote sensing missions using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 该领域通过使用分层嵌套尺度的仪器方法来应对多尺度生态水文过程的挑战。进行了多个强观测期和连续的水文气象观测，使用不同规模的仪器来捕捉这些过程。这包括一个通量观测矩阵，包含涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站，以及使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的航空遥感任务。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the challenges faced in ensuring the availability and quality control of datasets related to oasis–desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在确保与绿洲-沙漠系统相关的数据集的可用性和质量控制方面面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in this field include the poor availability of multiscale observations and ensuring data quality. The datasets are carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and generation. Long-term observations are indispensable to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which requires robust data processing and quality control procedures, including data collection, processing, and archiving.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 该领域面临的挑战包括多尺度观测的稀缺性和确保数据质量。在传感器校准、数据收集、处理和生成的整个过程中，数据集都经过精心的质量控制。长期观测对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要，这需要强有力的数据处理和质量控制程序，包括数据收集、处理和归档。
